### Psychology Services Tender Announcement
#### Solicitation Number: 21470-27-4456295

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is soliciting proposals for the provision of Aftercare Psychology Services for the Guelph Area Parole Offices, commencing on April 1, 2024.

**Background and Objectives:**
The CSC, in partnership with the Government of Canada, is seeking a registered psychologist with expertise in cognitive-behavioral treatment and offender population specialization to provide Aftercare Psychology Services. The successful service provider must deliver high quality, results-oriented services that align with CSC Mental Health Policy and Integrated Mental Health Guidelines.

**Services Provided:**
The successful service provider will be required to deliver the following services:

* Conduct mental health and psychological assessments for offenders referred by the Project Authority
* Develop individualized treatment plans utilizing evidence-based cognitive-behavioral approaches
* Provide psychological support and counseling services to offenders, taking into account individual differences (age, gender, cultural, linguistic, etc.)
* Consult with the Project Authority to ensure services are consistent with relevant legislation and guidelines

**Duration of Contract and Timelines:**
The initial contract term is 12 months, commencing on April 1, 2024. The successful service provider is also expected to meet specified reporting deadlines.

**Contracting Authority and Contact:**
The contracting authority is Jill Emmons, located at P.O. Box 1174, 445 Union St West, Kingston, Ontario, K7L4Y8. Interested suppliers can contact her via email at [Jill.Emmons@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:Jill.Emmons@csc-scc.gc.ca) or by phone at (613) 329-2694.

**Tendering Procedures:**
This tender is open to all interested suppliers who submit a compliant bid. The bid solicitation package, including the complete statement of work and evaluation criteria, is available on the Government of Canada's tender opportunities website.

**Submission of Proposals:**
Proposals must be submitted in either English or French, in accordance with Government of Canada's language policies. The debriefing process will be available to all bidders upon request.

The tender closing date is September 18, 2023, at 14:00. The Government of Canada reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. 

**Confidentiality and Security:**
Confidentiality and security measures will be applied to protect the sensitive information and data shared during the procurement
